author: Peter Ruscitti
text:
Good morning,
I'm re-evaluating the amount of cash and checks that my city should keep on hand in the event of a disaster.  (Note: I am not referring budgetary reserves, but actual hard cash/checks kept in case a major disaster knocks out banking and communications networks.)  This was a critical issue for many municipalities after Hurricane Katrina.
To that end, I am wondering:
- How much cash does your city/county keep on hand for emergency management purposes?
- How many handwritten checks does your city/county keep on hand for emergency management purposes?
- How did your city determine these amounts (if known)?
The answers I have found thus far range from $0 to $250,000. 
I appreciate everyone's help in gathering this useful information.
Thank you,
Pete Ruscitti
Office of Emergency Management
City of Beverly Hills

Beverly Hills CA 90210
